Docs.summary: Camera which specifies the view and projection transforms as objects

remarks.format:
## Remarks This camera enables applications to calculate their own view and projection matrices. This allows applications to define cameras not directly supported by the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.ProjectionCamera> subclasses.
Using a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MatrixCamera> is the only way an application can know what the View/Projection matrices are.
A <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MatrixCamera> can be animated using the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Camera.Transform%2A> property.
## Examples The following code creates a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MatrixCamera> and sets the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MatrixCamera.ViewMatrix%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MatrixCamera.ProjectionMatrix%2A> properties.
